Tweet: Because it was my choice.
Being a mother is the scariest
column3: most exciting
column4: most exhausting and thrilling job I've ever had. And I wouldn't trade it for the world.

Tweet: No man will EVER understand what happens to a woman from the second that faint line shows up on a test strip and they know...
You have no place to make her decide between the child you forced her to carry for nine months and the future she has worked for.
You have no place to force the most awesome responsibility in life onto an unwilling participant.
Unless the answer to those ?'s are that you will be fighting beside her for her success and supporting her
column3: you have no place to speak now.

Tweet: Where will you be when the emotional needs of a child are wearing on her and the financial needs are drowning her?
Where will you be when that woman is forced to move to a neighborhood with worse schools and a risky crime rate because she lost that job?
Where will you be when the postpartum depression hits or the medical costs of a special needs child arise?
Where will you be when she loses her job because her child's asthma is so bad that she had to take off another day for treatment?
Where will you be for the 6 weeks before any daycare will take that baby so that she can go back to the career she worked so hard for?
Where will you be when the complications arise during pregnancy and that woman is placed on bed rest?
mother
column3: I ask these questions:
